title: ServiceNow and OpenAI Push AI Past Chatbots into Real CX Work
summary: ServiceNow and OpenAI have partnered to push AI beyond chatbots and into real customer experience (CX) work. They aim to target the gap between customer requests and actual resolution, moving past traditional automation and speech agents. The partnership represents a strategic shift in the CCaaS space, leveraging AI for more effective customer service solutions.
hook: ServiceNow, OpenAI partnership: AI moving beyond chatbots into real CX work!

title: The $50 Billion Question: How Do You Charge for an AI Agent Seat That Doesnâ€™t Exist?
summary: Autonomous AI agents are handling 30-40% of tasks previously done by humans in the contact center space, leading to a shift in pricing models. CFOs are demanding discounts, vendors are absorbing compute volatility, and pricing teams are redesigning contracts to accommodate this change. The traditional model of pricing per human agent is being challenged by the rise of AI.
hook: AI agents shake up CCaaS pricing models, forcing CFOs to adapt.

title: Customer service and contact center
summary: The article discusses the impact of AI on enterprise workflows, including customer service, and the rise of remote work leading to innovations in field service management. It also notes that customer experience is undergoing significant changes, which business tech buyers should take into account. However, it does not provide specific details about the CCaaS market or related technologies.
hook: AI reshaping enterprise workflows, including customer service; CX undergoing major changes.

title: Features
summary: The article discusses the shift in AI decisions from capability to ownership, control, and accountability. It also mentions the potential of agentic commerce, like ChatGPT shopping, to streamline B2B product procurement, with a focus on enterprise infrastructure, security, and purchasing validation processes. Two early adopters of Salesforce's agentic AI have successfully tailored it to their customer service business needs.
hook: AI decisions shift focus; agentic commerce potential in B2B procurement.

title: Tips
summary: The article discusses the impact of remote work on field service management, the importance of visual search strategies for e-commerce professionals and CX leaders, and highlights key CX trends that business tech buyers should consider. It does not directly mention Contact Center as a Service (CCaaS) or provide specific insights into the CCaaS market.
hook: Remote work reshaping field service management and CX trends!

title: Customer Experience Definitions
summary: The article discusses the importance of a 360-degree customer view and account-based experience (ABX) in understanding customers and providing a personalized experience. It also highlights the value of actionable insights derived from data. These strategies are crucial in the Contact Center / CCaaS / CX space for improving customer interactions and service.

title: Podcasts
summary: The 'Pipeline' podcast features discussions on the complexities of customer experience (CX) metrics, the challenges of migrating legacy on-premises contact center platforms to the cloud, and the future of the Marketo marketing automation platform. The discussions involve CX expert Scott Sachs and Marketo VP Matt Zilli. The podcast also covers what Salesforce CRM users can expect from Marketo.
hook: Experts discuss CX complexities and cloud migration in 'Pipeline' podcast.
